concept.title: Roles in the writing process
concept.shortdesc: There are a number of roles involved in the production of DITA-based information. Each role consists of a related set of responsibilities and activities.

conbody.p: On any given team, these roles may be divided up any number of different ways. On a small team, one writer may play all roles; on a larger team, some writers may have dedicated roles. Roles aren't the same thing as people: one person may play many roles, and one role may be fulfilled by several people. However, you should make sure that each role is being fulfilled: even if nobody is a full-time information architect, for example, it is still important that someone have responsibility for the end-to-end flow of the tasks, the coherence and consistency of the concepts, and the retrievability of the reference information.
